contentrichtext.text: {{PennPlaceMap|Cambria|Spring Hill}} '''Spring Hill''' is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[Cambria County, Pennsylvania|Cambria County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. The population was 970 at the 2000 census. ==Geography== Spring Hill is located at {{coord|40.374494|-78.667533|type:city_region:US|format=dms|display=inline,title}} (40.374494, -78.667533).{{GR|1}} According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|1.0|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 970 people, 389 households, and 273 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 951.1 people per square mile (367.2/km<sup>2</sup>). There were 408 housing units at an average density of 400.0/sq mi (154.4/km<sup>2</sup>). The racial makeup of the CDP was 98.66% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.21% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.31% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 0.82% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 0.72% of the population. There were 389 households out of which 22.9% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 56.3% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 9.3% had a female householder with no husband present, and 29.8% were non-families. 28.0% of all households were made up of individuals and 18.8% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.48 and the average family size was 3.03. In the CDP the population was spread out with 19.1% under the age of 18, 8.1% from 18 to 24, 27.0% from 25 to 44, 25.4% from 45 to 64, and 20.4% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 42 years. For every 100 females there were 91.3 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 88.2 males. The median income for a household in the CDP was $29,750, and the median income for a family was $33,472. Males had a median income of $26,750 versus $17,868 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $16,688. About 3.5% of families and 8.2% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 14.7% of those under age 18 and 19.0% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> {{Cambria County, Pennsylvania}} [[Category:Census-designated places in Cambria County, Pennsylvania]]
